intro: Mutellina corsica var. mufraricciae, commonly known as the Corsican mufrariccia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the island of Corsica. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy odor when crushed. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species within its native range.
